flags.comment: First use of the view command
The bay doors open for the first time
Locked gate to thrusters has been opened
Your brain has been loaded onto the lander
You've escaped the ship and landed on planet

items.description: Packed away are folds of wires, mechanisms, and metal sheet, illuminated by flashes and sparks. It appears things here are in disrepair.

locations.name: Nosecone
locations.description: The bot stops as it reaches the end of the rail. Here, the walls taper into a point, forming a conical shape. Free space is limited.

locations.name: Onboard Computer
locations.description: A smooth, cylindrical tunnel wraps around the bot rails, made out of reflective chrome panels. Small labels mark each panel, indicating which computer system is housed there.

locations.name: Carrier
locations.description: About twenty bulky spheres embed into the tunnel walls around the bot rails, each marked by a word--a name. Closest to the camera reads 'Julian.' Each sphere's status is indicated by a small LED light; and all lights are red. All except one, shining green alone. You feel your stomach sinking.

locations.name: Life Support
locations.description: This room is all sterile and bright. Glossy white plastic plates machinery to prevent any corrosion. On opposite sides of the tunnel are two bright stripes, either red or blue, 'Blood' or 'Water.' Several manual control switches are placed along the stripes, underneath the labels.

locations.name: Cargo Bay
locations.description: Majestic space stretches before you, enclosed by metal walls, with grated patterns covering the surface. Debris fills the space, floating in a big mess. You have some difficulty trying to pinpoint the cause for the mess, and it's concerning.

locations.name: Reactor Monitor
locations.description: The rail ends here. In engraved letters on the far wall: 'Reactor Monitor.' In contrast with the rest of the ship, the walls here are of dark and clunky metal, and thick bolts secure them. It is as if only the strongest of materials will hold, where design is unable to afford thought for aesthetic.
